snippet: For decades, environmentalists have worked to reduce the undersea din — usually with little success, given the growing industrialization and militarization of the oceans.
abstract: Environmentalists have been working for decades to reduce the undersea din caused by the growing industrialization and militarization of the world's oceans, phenomenon that many associate with whale beachings; finding that some whales can protectively desensitize their hearing adds another layer to the debate, though researchers say it would address only a relatively small component of the problem of oceanic noise.
lead_paragraph: For decades, environmentalists have worked to reduce the undersea din — usually with little success, given the growing industrialization and militarization of the oceans.

headline.seo: Discovery Adds to Debate on How to Reduce Undersea Noise
